instructions: Image titled Open Google Docs Step 1 1 Locate the Google Docs file you want to open. To read or view a file created in Google Docs (with a file name ending in .gdoc ), you need to open it in Google Docs. You can do this on the Google Docs website or the mobile app. [1] If the file is attached to an email, download it to your computer now by clicking the attachment, then saving it to your desktop. If you received an email message that says (user) has invited you to edit the following document, simply click the button that says Open in Docs to view and edit the file. [2] Image titled Open Google Docs Step 2 2 Download the Google Docs app if you are using a mobile device. If you have an iPhone or iPad, install it from the App Store . On Android, install it from the Play Store. Image titled Open Google Docs Step 3 3 Double-click the Google Doc file. The file is now open in Google Docs. If you are on a computer, the document automatically opened your default web browser. On your mobile device, it should open in the Google Docs app. If you have not yet logged into your Google account, Google Docs will prompt you to do so. Advertisement

Image titled Open Google Docs Step 14 1 Sign up for a Google Account. [7] To use Google Docs, you must have a Google account. If you do not have one, sign up now . If you re using a mobile device, you should also install the Google Docs app. iPhone and iPad users can get it from the App Store . On Android, grab it from the Play Store. Image titled Open Google Docs Step 15 2 Click the app menu icon (9 square boxes) at the top right corner of the screen of Google.com , then select Drive . You are now viewing your Google Drive. In the mobile app, tap the + icon. Image titled Open Google Docs Step 16 3 Click New, then select Google Docs. Now you ll see a brand new Google Docs file open in the program. Mobile users, tap New Document instead. Google Docs files save automatically, so there s no need to press Save when you re done. Advertisement
